title: HttpModule request method doesn't handle observe:response.
No way to get __prop__metadata__ in decorator using AOT
body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I want to create a decorator and wrap all of lifecycle methods and constructor. Log decorator for example. For now it can't be done in AOT because of properties ``` export const ANNOTATIONS = '__annotations__'; export const PARAMETERS = '__parameters__'; export const PROP_METADATA = '__prop__metadata__'; ``` from file angular/packages/core/src/util/decorators.ts I can see that reflect api (like Reflect.getOwnMetadata('annotations')) stopped working. So where these properties are hidden in AOT? Is it correct and there is no way to get them in AOT so annotations now is private api? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction There is working example in JIT https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-jgrit5 ## üî• Exception or Error @Inputs stopped working, because of lost __prop__metadata__ ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 8.1.1
Node: 10.15.3
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 8.1.1
... cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, upgrade

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.801.1
@angular-devkit/core         8.1.1
@angular-devkit/schematics   8.1.1
@ngtools/webpack             8.1.1
@schematics/angular          8.1.1
@schematics/update           0.801.1
rxjs                         6.5.2
typescript                   3.4.5
webpack                      4.35.3
**Anything else relevant?**

title: fix(zone.js): fix browser legacy package should not reference Zone directly
body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/31975

in legacy browser, the browser will
1. load `zone-legacy.js` to init some `factory methods` to patch some old APIs, those patch 
will not be called immediately, `zone-legacy.js` will register those factory methods to `global['__zone_symbol__('legacyPatch')']`, `zone-evergreen.js` will call those old APIs later.
2. load `zone-evergreen.js` and call global['__zone_symbol__('legacyPatch')'] to patch `legacy apis`.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

title: refactoring(language-service): Remove 'context' used for module resolution

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
The language service relies on a "context" file that is used as the
canonical "containing file" when performing module resolution.
This file is unnecessary since the language service host's current
directory always default to the location of tsconfig.json for the
project, which would give the correct result.

This refactoring allows us to simplify the "typescript host" and also
removes the need for custom logic to find tsconfig.json.

title: fix(ivy): CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA error not thrown for unknown elements
body:
VE warns the user that an element is unknown and asks to verify that
the component is part of the module or to add CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA or
NO_ERRORS_SCHEMA. This fix ensures the error appears in Ivy as well.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
VE throws error while Ivy does not when there is an unknown element

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
Both VE and Ivy throw the same error when there is an unknown element.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

## Other information

body:

IVY ### Description When compiling my app with IVY enabled, it throws below error (I am following instructions available on official IVY guide https://angular.io/guide/ivy): ``` 0% compiling Compiling ng2-ckeditor : main as commonjs chunk {0} runtime-es2015.10a1f01eef199006286d.js (runtime) 1.41 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {1} main-es2015.601938459e47ad4810a2.js (main) 128 bytes [initial] [rendered] chunk {2} polyfills-es2015.57a4297f1bb8472f293f.js (polyfills) 130 bytes [initial] [rendered] chunk {3} styles.09e193d08f365ca57de0.css (styles) 197 kB [initial] [rendered] Date: 2019-08-04T23:20:28.090Z - Hash: 8e9af5da311b34546887 - Time: 6779ms ERROR in SourceMapGenerator.prototype.applySourceMap requires either an explicit source file, or the source map's "file" property. Both were omitted. ``` I have sitemaps disabled SourceMap, yet its throwing error for SiteMapGenerator. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

title: ionic 4 angular 8 ionic lab windows platform bug
body:
Hey i am trying to run a simple ionic blank --type=angular project in ionic lab on localhost:8200.
The ios and android platfoms are working well but the windows platform doesn't work, it shows black screen in the virtual emulator. I checked in the google browser inspect element and ther is the issue:
Error: Cannot find module './undefined.entry.js'
    at .*\.entry\.js$ include: \.entry\.js$ exclude: \.system\.entry\.js$ namespace object:394
    at ZoneDelegate.invoke (zone-evergreen.js:365)
    at Zone.run (zone-evergreen.js:124)
    at zone-evergreen.js:851
    at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone-evergreen.js:400)
    at Zone.runTask (zone-evergreen.js:168)
    at drainMicroTaskQueue (zone-evergreen.js:570)

zone-evergreen.js:659 Unhandled Promise rejection: Cannot read property 'isProxied' of undefined ; Zone: <root> ; Task: Promise.then ; Value: TypeError: Cannot read property 'isProxied' of undefined
    at initializeComponent (chunk-84f6bf13.js:1684) TypeError: Cannot read property 'isProxied' of undefined
    at initializeComponent (http://localhost:8100/vendor.js:104980:24)

title: Correct description of animation example

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [ ] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
 The description of a code example is incorrect. 
https://angular.io/guide/complex-animation-sequences

Issue Number:  https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30287


## What is the new behavior?
Text is changed to correctly describe what the example code is doing. The example doesn't need to change, as the point of it is to show `query()` and `stagger()` working together - it doesn't matter that is doesn't show "entering and leaving the page".

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
